meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound.
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate began to creesh as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The old door would creesh loudly whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent3: The creesh of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The car's brakes started to creesh like a rusty hinge.
meanings.sent5: The metal spoon creeshed against the ceramic bowl, creating an unpleasant noise.

meanings.sent1: The constant creesh of the train wheels against the tracks was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The eerie creesh echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent3: The creesh of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the creesh of the metal gate across the field.
meanings.sent5: The sudden creesh of the brakes made everyone in the car jump.

meanings.sent1: She would creesh the knife against the stone to sharpen it.
meanings.sent2: The branches would creesh against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The creesh of the pencil against the paper was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The old hinges creeshed as the door swung open.
meanings.sent5: The dry leaves creeshed underfoot as they walked through the forest.
